subtitle: Prepare this beautiful gateau for a party or special occasions.

method.text: Preheat oven to 190°C. Lightly grease and flour two 18 cm round sandwich tins.
Mix the hazelnuts and flour together in a bowl.
Beat the eggs and sugar together with a hand whisk or electric whisk until thick and creamy - you should be able to see the trail of the whisk.
Melt the butter or margarine, taking care not to overheat.
Fold the nut mixture into the beaten eggs and sugar. Gently but thoroughly, fold in the melted butter or margarine.
Spoon the mixture into the sandwich tins. Bake for 15 min, or until firm to a gentle touch. Cool for 3-4 min in the tins. Then turn out onto a wire cooling tray to cool completely.
Crush half the raspberries and blend with the sugar. Whip the cream until it stands in soft peaks.

Sandwich the sponges together with the raspberry pulp and some of the cream. Spread the top of the sponge with the remaining cream and pipe a border around the gateau. Top with the remaining raspberries and the whole hazelnuts.

title: Hazelnut and raspberry gateau
